entry.title: Make It Wayne
entry.summary:
Author: waynewolfling

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 37,797Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 221

Summary: Gotham’s most infamous billionaire playboy, Bruce Wayne, has spent years building a reputation—just not a good one. Between scandalous headlines, a trail of ex-lovers, and his ridiculous reality TV show, Make It Wayne, no one takes him too seriously. And that’s exactly how he likes it.But when life introduces him to a painfully charming journalist, Bruce starts to wonder if he’s finally losing control of the carefully crafted mess that is his life.

entry.title: And I don't wanna go home yet
entry.summary:
Author: LuiGarMir

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,646Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 89

Summary: When Clark met Bruce, he didn’t think much of the man. Well, no. He’d had thoughts—a lot of them having to do with his chiseled jaw and broad shoulders—but he hadn’t seen past Batman’s dark, gloomy, unknowable persona.The man—barely a young adult when they met—had been polite and deadly efficient, but also cold and distant.Clark, a journalist at heart, wanted to know more about him, but Superman understood how precious secrecy and privacy were. So… He gave Batman some space.It took him years to discover the man’s civilian name. And it just so happened to be around the same time both men started getting closer. Or it was maybe the reason why they got close at all.

entry.title: The Baddams Family Adventures
entry.summary:
Author: petting_a_bumblebee

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 38,465Chapters: 21/23Kudos: 1,213

Summary: Flash halted as a shadowy tendril leaped from Batman’s cape and slithered toward the side table. The tendril snatched a pie knife while its identical twin took a plate from the near pile. They cut a hefty piece, which they delivered to Batman’s waiting hand. Batman took a long and audible sniff off the treat before the slice and the plate vanished into his shadows.“As Flash stated, it is tasty”, Batman said emphatically in the sudden silence of the meeting room. “The plate was not bad either. IKEA?”- Batboy-centric glimpses of the life of the most lovable monster family in Gotham.

entry.title: With All Due Respect
entry.summary:
Author: BlueGrapefruitSoda

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,859Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 81

Summary: Bruce gave a slight smile, his voice low and curiosity piqued. “You have permission to speak.” Clark shifted uncomfortably, his gaze dropping to the ground. “As someone who’s dedicated his life to your safety and happiness,” he began, his voice quiet but steady, “it matters deeply to me that you choose a partner truly worthy of you — someone who honors your love and your loyalty.” He drew in a slow breath, then lifted his eyes to meet Bruce’s. “And I’m afraid, my prince… the man you’re considering is not that person.”Or Clark is in love with Bruce, the prince he protects and Bruce is oblivious.

entry.title: The Buttered Cat Paradox
entry.summary:
Author: writersagainstwritersblock

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,908Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 412

Summary: “No comment.”“You don’t know what I was going to ask,” Clark said with a hint of a smile. “Maybe I just wanted to congratulate you on catching the Film Freak.”Bruce gave him a flat look.“Or maybe I think I can help.”“With a case of vandalism?”Clark stepped in front of him. “It’s not vandalism and you know it, detective.”“And what makes you say that?”“If it were vandalism it would be something a lot more juvenile. To the point. It wouldn’t claim there were seventeen missing kids. That’s public outcry.”“Is that so?”“That and I tried to do a story on the growing number of homeless children last month and I got shut down. According to the last count, the numbers have been decreasing, but there’s been no change in policies, no extra funding to CPS, or shelters, or even an increase in the number of inmates in the juvenile detention center. So where are they going?” Detective Bruce Wayne may have the highest solve rate in Gotham, but if he wants to solve this case, he’ll need the help of an elusive street kid, and while Dick Grayson always lands on his feet, he usually lands himself right into trouble.

entry.summary:
Author: Winkaku

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,449Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 195

Summary: They'd been caught in each others orbit for some time now and, quite frankly, Clark should have seen this coming. Crazy was part and parcel to Gotham after all... let alone his own life.
